review_blob: A lower alcohol version of their flagship Goldline IPA. The flavor of an IPA without the high alcohol content, which is nice when you are planning on hanging out for a few hours.

While I generally dont go for sweet beers, this vanilla porter is as fun as it is delicious, which is to say, quite. While a limited beer, it is my understanding that they intend to rotate in frequently. A great beer for your friends that are not big into beer.
This was the beer that changed my mind about pilsners. While very limited, they only make it once a year or so, it is worth making into the taste room. And then never touching a cheap domestic again.
While less hoppy than many other Colorado IPAs, the Goldline features a balanced flavor. Also, the hops used do not have that overtly floral overtones prominent in many IPAs.
